title: Simple Linear Regression Theorem
contentHtml: The Simple Linear Regression theorem provides a fundamental framework for modeling relationships between two continuous variables.

theorem.proofSketch: The proof involves showing that the least squares estimate of the regression coefficients minimizes the expected squared error.

intuition: This theorem provides a way to model and analyze relationships between two continuous variables, with implications for prediction and inference in various fields.
realWorldApplications: Predicting housing prices based on features like square footage

subject: statistics
title: Simple Linear Regression Theorem
contentHtml:
The Simple Linear Regression theorem is a fundamental concept in statistical modeling.

It states that the best-fitting linear regression line minimizes the sum of squared residuals.

theorem.proofSketch: The proof involves showing that the least squares estimator is unbiased and consistent.

intuition: This theorem provides a mathematical justification for the common practice of using linear regression to model relationships between variables.
realWorldApplications: Predicting housing prices based on features like number of bedrooms and square footage
